subject: Re: [junit] Class-level Parameterized Test
msgSnippet: ... I agree, I think it s overkill.  Why not use something similar to TestNG s Data Providers, since the only thing that changes between tests is just a
messageBody:
On 6/8/07, Ed Smith <edsmithed@...> wrote:

> Thanks for the response. The only thing that changes between my tests is
> the DB URL (string). Having to maintain a subclass for each db AND
> a test suite listing all of the subclasses seems onerous.

I agree, I think it's overkill. Why not use something similar to
TestNG's Data Providers, since the only thing that changes between
tests is just a string?

For example:

@DataProvider
public Object[][] databases() {
return new Object[][] {
new Object[] { "com.oracle.JDBCDriver" },
new Object[] { "com.microsoft.JDBCDriver" },
}
}

@Test(dataProvider = "databases")
public void myTest(String driverName) {
// will be invoked one for each driver name
}

--
Cédric
